content.text: I'll research the MITRE ATT&CK Detection Strategies framework and provide comprehensive information about its components, implementation, and application to Wazuh SIEM/EDR analytics.

input.query: MITRE ATT&CK detection strategies vs techniques tactics
MITRE ATT&CK detection strategies log sources telemetry
detection strategies behavioral chains MITRE ATT&CK
Wazuh MITRE ATT&CK detection strategies implementation

Links: [{"title":"MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/"},{"title":"What is the Difference Between MITRE ATT&CK Sub-Techniques and Procedures? - Palo Alto Networks","url":"https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/cyberpedia/mitre-attack-sub-techniques-vs-procedures"},{"title":"What Are MITRE ATT&CK Techniques? - Palo Alto Networks","url":"https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/cyberpedia/what-are-mitre-attack-techniques"},{"title":"FAQ | MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/resources/faq/"},{"title":"Quick Guide to MITRE ATT&CK: Matrices, Tactics, Techniques & More","url":"https://www.cynet.com/network-attacks/quick-guide-to-mitre-attck-matrices-tactics-techniques-more/"},{"title":"Tactics - Enterprise | MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/tactics/enterprise/"},{"title":"What is the MITRE ATT&CK Framework? | IBM","url":"https://www.ibm.com/think/topics/mitre-attack"},{"title":"Detection Strategies | MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/detectionstrategies/"},{"title":"Techniques - Enterprise | MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/enterprise/"},{"title":"Mitre ATT&CK Framework: Guide to Mapping Adversary Techniques to Defenses | Microminder Cybersecurity | Holistic Cybersecurity Services","url":"https://www.micromindercs.com/blog/mitre-attack-framework-guide"}]

Based on the search results, here's an overview of detection strategies, techniques, and tactics in the MITRE ATT&CK framework:

## Core Components

Tactics represent the "why" of an ATT&CK technique—the adversary's tactical goal and reason for performing an action.(no content)Techniques represent "how" an adversary achieves a tactical goal by performing an action.

## Detection Strategies

Detection strategies define high-level approaches for detecting specific adversary techniques.(no content)Detection methods typically are log data or system data sources that security teams or security software can monitor for evidence of the technique.

## Practical Application

Effectively detecting and mitigating MITRE ATT&CK techniques requires a structured approach that moves beyond simple signature matching to behavioral analysis, with organizations developing comprehensive telemetry, analytics, and control validation processes to counter adversary actions by collecting the correct data and applying appropriate analytical methods to identify deviations from normal behavior or indicators of malicious activity.(no content)By mapping alerts to ATT&CK techniques, security teams can quickly understand the context of attacks and prioritize responses based on threat severity and potential impact.

The framework provides a hierarchical structure where tactics define the "why," techniques define the "how," and detection strategies provide the methods to identify when these techniques are being used.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Smarter Detection Strategies in ATT&CK | by Lex Crumpton | MITRE ATT&CK® | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/mitre-attack/what-comes-after-detection-rules-smarter-detection-strategies-in-att-ck-7e6738fec31f"},{"title":"Detection Strategies | MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/detectionstrategies/"},{"title":"What’s New in MITRE ATT&CK v18: Detection Strategies and Analytics Unveiled","url":"https://www.picussecurity.com/resource/blog/whats-new-in-mitre-attack-v18"},{"title":"Inside Cybersecurity: New threat detection taxonomy in ATT&CK framework | MITRE","url":"https://www.mitre.org/news-insights/media-coverage/inside-cybersecurity-new-threat-detection-taxonomy-attck-framework"},{"title":"MITRE details ATT&CK v18 Detection overhaul to mirror real-world adversary behaviour, launching this October - Industrial Cyber","url":"https://industrialcyber.co/threat-landscape/mitre-details-attck-v18-detection-overhaul-to-mirror-real-world-adversary-behaviour-launching-this-october/"},{"title":"What Is MITRE ATT&CK Framework? - Palo Alto Networks","url":"https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/cyberpedia/what-is-mitre-attack"},{"title":"MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/"},{"title":"ATT&CK v18: Detection Strategies, More Adversary Insights,","url":"https://medium.com/mitre-attack/attack-v18-8f82d839ee9e"},{"title":"MITRE ATT&CK v18: What’s in it — and why it matters | ReversingLabs","url":"https://www.reversinglabs.com/blog/mitre-attck-v18-whats-in-it--and-why-it-matters"},{"title":"What is the MITRE ATT&CK Framework? | Balbix","url":"https://www.balbix.com/insights/what-is-the-mitre-attck-framework/"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about detection strategies and behavioral chains in MITRE ATT&CK:

## Overview of Detection Strategies

Detection strategies define high-level approaches for detecting specific adversary techniques.(no content)Detection strategies now capture those multi-event, cause-and-effect behavior chains, not just tool-specific signatures.

## Behavioral Chains Focus

A key innovation in MITRE ATT&CK v18 is the emphasis on behavioral chains. Detection Strategies now connect behaviors across tactics, notably between Execution and Persistence, enabling defenders to trace attack chains and validate detection coverage at a behavioral level. This addresses a significant gap: Detection logic was often designed to assess isolated events rather than behavior chains, making it easier for adversaries to slip through.

## Structural Components

Each detection strategy includes three key elements: a Detection Strategy ID, a Detection Strategy Name, and one or more associated Analytic IDs. Each analytic includes five key elements: its ID, Platform, Detection Statement, Log Source, and Mutable Elements, capturing platform-specific logic, relevant telemetry, and tuning options.

## Practical Implementation

The guidance provides clarity on several fronts: the behavior to observe, the required log data, which parameters are tunable, and which components are fixed and define the ATT&CK technique.(no content)ATT&CK's new model links strategies, analytics, and log sources into reusable blueprints tailored to real-world telemetry.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Web search results for query: "MITRE ATT&CK detection strategies framework 2025"

Links: [{"title":"Updates - Updates - October 2025 | MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/resources/updates/updates-october-2025/"},{"title":"What’s New in MITRE ATT&CK v18: Detection Strategies and Analytics Unveiled","url":"https://www.picussecurity.com/resource/blog/whats-new-in-mitre-attack-v18"},{"title":"MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/"},{"title":"MITRE Unveils ATT&CK v18 With Updates to Detections, Mobile, ICS - SecurityWeek","url":"https://www.securityweek.com/mitre-unveils-attck-v18-with-updates-to-detections-mobile-ics/"},{"title":"ATT&CK v18: The Detection Overhaul You’ve Been Waiting For | by Amy L. Robertson | MITRE ATT&CK® | Oct, 2025 | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/mitre-attack/attack-v18-8f82d839ee9e"},{"title":"MITRE ATT&CK | MITRE","url":"https://www.mitre.org/focus-areas/cybersecurity/mitre-attack"},{"title":"What Comes After Detection Rules? Smarter Detection Strategies in ATT&CK | by Lex Crumpton | MITRE ATT&CK® | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/mitre-attack/smarter-detection-strategies-in-attack-7e6738fec31f"},{"title":"Inside Cybersecurity: New threat detection taxonomy in ATT&CK framework | MITRE","url":"https://www.mitre.org/news-insights/media-coverage/inside-cybersecurity-new-threat-detection-taxonomy-attck-framework"},{"title":"MITRE ATT&CK® Framework Guide: Tactics, Techniques & More","url":"https://www.picussecurity.com/mitre-attack-framework"},{"title":"Taming the Digital Wilderness: Your Guide to the MITRE ATT&CK® Framework. | by Cyberbali | Nov, 2025 | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@cyberbali/taming-the-digital-wilderness-your-guide-to-the-mitre-att-ck-framework-aea51a16a772"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about MITRE ATT&CK detection strategies framework in 2025:

## Overview

The MITRE ATT&CK Framework v18.0 was released on October 28, 2025, introducing one of the most transformative updates in the framework's history: the retirement of traditional Detections and Data Sources, which are now replaced by Detection Strategies and Analytics.

## Key Components of the New Framework

MITRE has replaced traditional "Detections" and "Data Sources" with a new two-tier detection model: Detection Strategies (DETxxxx), which are high-level defensive approaches that describe how to identify adversary behaviors. Analytics (ANxxxx) are specific behavioral or telemetry-based analytic implementations that make detections actionable.

## Scope of Updates

The Enterprise domain now includes 691 Detection Strategies and 1,739 Analytics, the Mobile domain has 124 Detection Strategies with 211 Analytics, and the ICS domain features 83 Detection Strategies and 82 Analytics.

## Strategic Significance

The detection strategies serve as a "behavioral-first blueprint that defines what the adversary behavior is, and why it matters" to help organizations better mitigate cyber threats. The text in ATT&CK's previous Detections often packed too many behaviors into a single block of text, making them hard to interpret or apply, and important platform differences were sometimes lost.

The 2025 framework represents a significant evolution toward more structured, actionable threat detection guidance across all three ATT&CK domains (Enterprise, Mobile, and ICS).


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"What Comes After Detection Rules? Smarter Detection Strategies in ATT&CK | by Lex Crumpton | MITRE ATT&CK® | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/mitre-attack/smarter-detection-strategies-in-attack-7e6738fec31f"},{"title":"MITRE ATT&CK v18: New Detection Strategies and Analytics Redefine Cyber Defense","url":"https://cymulate.com/blog/mitre-attack-v18/"},{"title":"What’s New in MITRE ATT&CK v18: Detection Strategies and Analytics Unveiled","url":"https://www.picussecurity.com/resource/blog/whats-new-in-mitre-attack-v18"},{"title":"ATT&CK v18: Detection Strategies, More Adversary Insights,","url":"https://medium.com/mitre-attack/attack-v18-8f82d839ee9e"},{"title":"MITRE details ATT&CK v18 Detection overhaul to mirror real-world adversary behaviour, launching this October - Industrial Cyber","url":"https://industrialcyber.co/threat-landscape/mitre-details-attck-v18-detection-overhaul-to-mirror-real-world-adversary-behaviour-launching-this-october/"},{"title":"Data Sources | MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/datasources/"},{"title":"MITRE ATT&CK v18: What’s in it — and why it matters | ReversingLabs","url":"https://www.reversinglabs.com/blog/mitre-attck-v18-whats-in-it--and-why-it-matters"},{"title":"Defense Planning with MITRE ATT&CK","url":"https://arctiq.com/blog/defense-planning-with-mitre-attck"},{"title":"Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK v18: Turning Detection Strategies into Real Defensive Capability | by olatunji osunji | Nov, 2025 | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@olatunjiosunji/operationalizing-mitre-att-ck-v18-turning-detection-strategies-into-real-defensive-capability-90afb916dfa6"},{"title":"Detection Strategies | MITRE ATT&CK®","url":"https://attack.mitre.org/detectionstrategies/"}]

I've found comprehensive information about MITRE ATT&CK detection strategies, log sources, and telemetry. Here are the key findings:

## Detection Strategies Framework

Detection strategies define high-level approaches for detecting specific adversary techniques.(no content)ATT&CK v18 introduced two new objects, Detection Strategies and Analytics, that shift guidance from single-sentence notes to structured, behavior-focused strategies.

## Key Components

The new model consists of three interconnected elements:

1. **Detection Strategies**: Detection Strategies map techniques through specific Data Components, with each layer building on the other from adversary behavior to detection logic to telemetry, creating a clear, testable path.

2. **Analytics**: Analytics are specific behavioral or telemetry-based analytic implementations that make detections actionable.(no content)Each Analytic is aligned to a specific platform, with explicit references to the necessary log sources, data components, and tunable thresholds.

3. **Log Sources**: Log Sources use clear naming (like wineventlog:security or auditd:SYSCALL) so you know exactly what telemetry you need.(no content)ATT&CK defines formal Log Source objects, each capturing platform-specific variations.

## Telemetry and Data Components

Data Components, the foundation of the MITRE ATT&CK detection layer, now provides clearer links between telemetry and Detection Strategies.(no content)This overhaul supports more granular mapping between data sources (e.g., endpoint logs, process monitoring) and adversary techniques.

## Real-World Application

Detection Strategies now connect behaviors across tactics, notably between Execution and Persistence, enabling defenders to trace attack chains and validate detection coverage at a behavioral level.

Web search results for query: "Wazuh MITRE ATT&CK detection strategies implementation"

Links: [{"title":"MITRE ATT&CK framework - Data analysis · Wazuh documentation","url":"https://documentation.wazuh.com/current/user-manual/ruleset/mitre.html"},{"title":"Emulation of ATT&CK techniques and detection with Wazuh | Wazuh","url":"https://wazuh.com/blog/emulation-of-attck-techniques-and-detection-with-wazuh/"},{"title":"Threat intelligence - Using Wazuh for NIST 800-53 compliance","url":"https://documentation.wazuh.com/current/compliance/nist/threat-intelligence.html"},{"title":"Proactive threat detection in enterprise systems using Wazuh: A MITRE ATT&CK Evaluation - ScienceDirect","url":"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0167404825003918"},{"title":"Home Lab#6: MITRE ATT&CK with Wazuh [Walkthrough]","url":"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/home-lab6-mitre-attck-wazuh-walkthrough-rajneesh-gupta-hro4f"},{"title":"Threat hunting - Use cases · Wazuh documentation","url":"https://documentation.wazuh.com/current/getting-started/use-cases/threat-hunting.html"},{"title":"Event Correlation with Wazuh + MITRE ATT&CK: Detecting Tactics, Not Just Techniques | by Ismael Barrantes | Sep, 2025 | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@ismapersonal97/event-correlation-with-wazuh-mitre-att-ck-detecting-tactics-not-just-techniques-b086bb2582e2"},{"title":"Threat hunting with MITRE ATT&CK and Wazuh","url":"https://thehackernews.com/2022/11/threat-hunting-with-mitre-att-and-wazuh.html"},{"title":"Wazuh Sysmon Detection Rules Fully Backed with MITRE ATT&CK — Now Available in Our Public Repo | by SOCFortress | Medium","url":"https://socfortress.medium.com/wazuh-sysmon-detection-rules-fully-backed-with-mitre-att-ck-now-available-in-our-public-repo-eae7ec90d865"},{"title":"Real-Time Threat Detection with Wazuh and MITRE ATT&CK","url":"https://prosperasoft.com/blog/cybersecurity/wazuh/real-time-threat-detection-wazuh-mitre-attck/"}]

Based on the search results, here's a comprehensive overview of Wazuh MITRE ATT&CK detection strategies and implementation:

## Overview

Wazuh offers out-of-the-box detection rules that are mapped against relevant MITRE IDs.(no content)Wazuh comes with the MITRE ATT&CK module out-of-the-box and threat detection rules mapped against their corresponding MITRE technique IDs.

## Key Implementation Strategies

### 1. **Rule Mapping and Configuration**

You can configure custom rules and assign corresponding MITRE ATT&CK IDs based on the techniques involved in the attack.(no content)Wazuh has out-of-the-box rules and decoders to parse security and runtime data generated from different sources. Wazuh supports rules for different technologies (e.g., Docker, CISCO, Microsoft Exchange), which have been mapped to their appropriate MITRE IDs. Users can also create custom rules and decoders and map each rule with its appropriate MITRE tactic or technique.

### 2. **Dashboard and Visualization**

The MITRE ATT&CK Dashboard tab provides an overview of the current state of your infrastructure with respect to known adversarial Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs) in the MITRE ATT&CK framework. The dashboard displays key indicators such as the total number of events, alerts, and a summary of the top 10 TTPs detected within your environment.

### 3. **Threat Hunting and Detection**

The Wazuh MITRE ATT&CK module maps TTPs to generated events, facilitating efficient threat hunting by promptly identifying patterns in attacker behavior.(no content)The framework component of the Wazuh MITRE ATT&CK module helps threat hunters narrow down threats or compromised endpoints. This component uses specific techniques to see all the events related to that technique and the endpoints where these events happened.

### 4. **Event Correlation**

By correlating multiple alerts into a single incident, Wazuh allows analysts to detect tactics (the "why") and not just techniques (the "how"), aligning detection with frameworks like MITRE ATT&CK.

## Module Components

The intelligence component of the Wazuh MITRE ATT&CK module contains detailed information about threat groups, mitigation, software, tactics, and techniques used in cyber attacks. This component helps threat hunters to identify and classify different TTPs that adversaries use.

## Real-World Evaluation

The experimental evaluation demonstrated that Wazuh was capable of detecting adversarial behaviors across the four selected and emphasized MITRE ATT&CK tactics, although the level of detection fidelity varied according to the tactic, technique, and operating system platform.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.
